question.subject: Foundation Grant
question.content:
Google Foundation is using this Grant to reach out to the world (Less privilege) with your help and corporation. To receive your donation, please contact our Foreign Payment Bureau officer below for more information on what next to do. 

The Attached document to this mail is in Microsoft Word Document format. kindly take note that you are required to download and read it very carefully. Do follow the guided instructions. Kindly contact George Hanson (info@adminofficeprocess.com). 

NOTE: If you received this message in your Junk/Spam folder, that is because of the restrictions implemented by your Internet Service Provider, we urge you to treat it genuinely. 

Yours in service,

Ms Marcus Oliver
Director of Accessibility
Powered by Google

mcq_options.option: Saying 'we urge you to treat it genuinely', makes it seem like not a phishing email
mcq_options.tooltip: This is a strong indicator of phishing, as urgent requests can create a false sense of urgency.

mcq_options.option: info@adminofficeprocess.com looks like it came from google
mcq_options.tooltip: This doesn't necessarily indicate phishing, as sender emails can be easily spoofed.

mcq_options.option: The sender email does not match the content of the email itself about Google Foundation
mcq_options.tooltip: Personalized greetings don't guarantee legitimacy, as phishers can use publicly available information.
Security-related subjects can be used by phishers to create a sense of urgency.

answers: kindly take note that you are required to download and read it very carefully. Do follow the guided instructions.
If you received this message in your Junk/Spam folder, that is because of the restrictions implemented by your Internet Service Provider, we urge you to treat it genuinely.

question.subject: Urgent: Account Suspension
question.content: Dear {username}, your account will be suspended due to suspicious activity. Click here to verify your account: http://phishingsite.com/Verify Now
question.mcq: What indicates this email might be phishing?

mcq_options.option: Urgent subject line and request for action
mcq_options.tooltip: This is a strong indicator of phishing, as urgent requests can create a false sense of urgency.
This doesn't necessarily indicate phishing, as sender emails can be easily spoofed.
Personalized greetings don't guarantee legitimacy, as phishers can use publicly available information.
Security-related subjects can be used by phishers to create a sense of urgency.

answers: Click here to verify your account: http://phishingsite.com/Verify Now
Dear {username}, your account will be suspended due to suspicious activity

question.subject: Security Update: Download Now
question.content: Dear {username}, download our latest security update: http://malwaresite.com/Download Now. Thank you
question.mcq: What raises suspicion about this email?

mcq_options.option: Request to download software from unknown source
mcq_options.tooltip: Downloading software from unknown sources can lead to malware infections.
An official-looking sender email doesn't guarantee the download is safe.
Personalized greetings don't ensure the email is legitimate.
Security-related subjects can be used to disguise malicious downloads.

answers: Dear {username}, download our latest security update: http://malwaresite.com/Download Now
